content: In J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle-earth, what is the Elvish word for friend, which also serves as a password into Moria?

The Elvish word for friend in J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle-earth is "mellon." It was used as a password to gain entry into the Mines of Moria, specifically at the doors of Durin. The word is from the Sindarin language, one of the Elvish languages created by Tolkien.
